page.title: 06Religion - Chapel
page.content: Adulam Baptist Chapel, Pontardawe was built in 1845 and rebuilt in 1889. The present membership is 60 and a visiting minister preaches every Sunday. There are 2 deacons and 4 deaconesses. Alltwen Congregational Chapel is Welsh Independent and is affiliated to the Union of Welsh Independents. It was founded in 1757 but the present building dates from 1886. 325 members are ministered by Mr. Gerwyn Jones and has an average of 50 attending every Sunday. It is governed democratically by 13 deacons and 1 deaconess elected by the members with 10 member trustees. Services are held in Welsh with a communion and children's service each month and Sunday School each Sunday. Chapels at Danygraig, Rhos and Gellinudd are Welsh speaking branches of Alltwen Mother Chapel.
